intro: Aeschynomene matosii, commonly known as the Matosii sesban, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and ability to fix nitrogen in the soil. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, branching stems and small, trifoliate leaves. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, elongated pods containing lens-shaped seeds. Aeschynomene matosii is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in semi-arid conditions.
